resume_professionnel: Embedded Systems Engineer with 1 year of experience at Continental Engineering Services, passionate about embedded systems and skilled in driver development, SoC architectures, low-level programming for embedded systems, and technical problem-solving. I am seeking a position starting from September 2024.

experiences_professionnelles.description: Integration, testing, and development of drivers for ADAS cameras, on Nvidia SoCs, debugging, and Nvidia forums.
Implementation of a 3-axis gimbal stabilizer (steadycam) using three servo motors utilizing the STM32 board.
Development of a simple 16-bit microprocessor using the Basys3 board.

experiences_professionnelles.titre: Internship: Improvement of an embedded control interface for machines
experiences_professionnelles.description: Evaluate the cause of performance issues in a virtual simulator, propose a solution that may involve an alternative data exchange method between data and the modbus/IPC3 interface other than the COM technology.
Implementation of a local messaging system using TCP and UDP protocols using Qt in C++. Implementing the Q-Learning method for the Frozen Lake game in the gym environment using Python.
Implementing the control of a ROVER. Controlling 4 ROVER motors, adding a distance sensor in bare-metal and real-time.

formations.titre: Bachelor's Degree in Electronics/Optics Embedded Systems

projets.titre: Final Year Project 'City Crossroads Traffic Lights with Priority Lanes Automation'

projets.description: focusing on the development and integration of drivers on Nvidia SoCs for the operation of cameras for ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems).
